meanings.sent1: The tornado threatened to annihilate the small town.
meanings.sent2: The superhero used his powers to annihilate the villain's evil plans.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to annihilate the pile of leaves by jumping into it.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's red pen seemed to annihilate all the mistakes on the student's paper.
meanings.sent5: The powerful earthquake could annihilate entire cities in seconds.

meanings.sent1: The explosion was so strong that it could annihilate any evidence of the crime.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a brush to carefully annihilate the pencil sketch and create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to annihilate the coin from existence.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury threatened to annihilate the fragile sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The powerful laser beam could annihilate any obstacles in its path.

meanings.sent1: The new pesticide was designed to annihilate the pests destroying the crops.
meanings.sent2: The medicine was able to annihilate the virus that had been spreading in the community.
meanings.sent3: The detective's keen eye could annihilate any alibi presented by the suspect.
meanings.sent4: The superhero's mission was to annihilate all traces of crime in the city.
meanings.sent5: The powerful vacuum cleaner could annihilate even the tiniest dust particles.

meanings.sent1: The flood threatened to annihilate the entire village, wiping out homes and crops.
meanings.sent2: The army was prepared to annihilate the enemy forces and wipe them out completely.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added too much salt, which could annihilate the flavor and wipe out the dish.
meanings.sent4: The tsunami's force could annihilate the coastal area, wiping out everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The powerful wind could annihilate the fragile sandcastle, wiping it out in seconds.
